title: What are the different aspects and purposes of sacrifice in different traditions and cultures?
first_phrase: In the last 200 tokens, the author dives deeper into the sacrificial act and how it can create or renew gods, using the heroic experience and the progression of the sacrificial action as a guide. The author also mentions the different aspects of the sacrificial ritual, including its iniziatic, magical, and operational sides, as well as the tradition of the vicarious victims. The author explores how the sacrificial act aims to channel and control primal chaos, and how it can deflet the effects of certain causes, a concept discussed earlier in the book.

last_phrase: In summary, sacrificial rituals have various aspects and traditions that are conditioned by their cultural context. From the initiatic and magical perspective to the idea of expiatory victims and the concept of sacrifice as redemption in Jewish and Christian traditions, the sacrifice was a significant practice throughout history. Even nowadays, it is essential to recognize and understand these practices' importance in our ancestors' lives to appreciate and respect different cultures' traditions.
